subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The Lord will not let the godly starve to death, but He refuses to satisfy the craving of the wicked. " (Pro. 10:3)
reflection: These statements are not intended to apply universally to all people in every situation. For example, some good people do go hungry. Rather they are intended to communicate the general truth that the life of the person who seeks God is better in the long run than the life of the wicked person---a life that leads to ruin. A proverb like this assumes a just government that cares for the poor and needy.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the practical wisdom for godly living at every stage of life, that is found in these proverbs. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The Lord will not let the godly starve to death, but He refuses_

_to satisfy the craving of the wicked." _(Pro. 10:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These statements are not intended to apply universally to all people

in every situation. For example, some good people do go hungry.

Rather they are intended to communicate the general truth that the

life of the person who seeks God is better in the long run than the

life of the wicked person---a life that leads to ruin. A proverb like

this assumes a just government that cares for the poor and needy.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the practical wisdom for

godly living at every stage of life, that is found in these proverbs.

Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Lazy people are soon poor, hard workers get rich. A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame. " (Pro. 10:4-5)
reflection: Very day has 24 hours of opportunity, to grow, serve, and be productive. Yet it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip from our grasp. Let us refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping or flittering away the hours meant for productive work. Let us see time as God's gift, and seize every opportunity to live diligently for Him.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would seek to grasp every opportunity to grow and serve You in a productive way. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Lazy people are soon poor, hard workers get rich._

_A wise youth works hard all summer; a youth who_

_sleeps away the hour of opportunity brings shame." _(Pro. 10:4-5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Very day has 24 hours of opportunity, to grow, serve, and be

productive. Yet it is so easy to waste time, letting life slip

from our grasp. Let us refuse to be a lazy person, sleeping

or flittering away the hours meant for productive work. Let

us see time as God's gift, and seize every opportunity to live

diligently for Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would seek to grasp every opportunity

to grow and serve You in a productive way. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "People with integrity have firm footing, but those who follow crooked paths will slip and fall. " (Pro. 10:9)
reflection: This refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly honors honesty! DISHONESTY cones easily, especially when complete honesty could, cost us something, make us uncomfortable, or put us in an unfavorable light.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would guide me to be honest under all circumstances, I pray this in the name of our Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"People with integrity have firm footing, but those who follow

crooked paths will slip and fall." (Pro. 10:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This refers to all lies, especially those told under oath. God truly

honors honesty! DISHONESTY cones easily, especially when complete

honesty could, cost us something, make us uncomfortable, or put us

in an unfavorable light.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would guide me to be honest

under all circumstances, I pray this in the name of our Lord and
Savior

Jesus Christ. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Hatred stirs up quarrels, but love covers all offenses. " (Pro. 10:12)
reflection: Our society confuses love and lust. Unlike lust, God's kind of love is directed outward toward others, not inward toward ourselves. God's love is utterly unselfish. This kind of love goes against our natural inclination.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me set aside my natural desires so that I can love without expecting anything in return. I pray that I would become more like Christ, so that I would have more love for others. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Hatred stirs up quarrels, but love covers all offenses."_

(Pro. 10:12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Our society confuses love and lust. Unlike lust, God's

kind of love is directed outward toward others, not

inward toward ourselves. God's love is utterly unselfish.

This kind of love goes against our natural inclination.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would help me set aside

my natural desires so that I can love without expecting anything

in return. I pray that I would become more like Christ, so that I

would have more love for others. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Wise people treasure knowledge, but the babbling of a fool invites trouble. (Pro. 10:14)
reflection: What you say and what you don't say are both important. To use proper speech you must NOT only say the right words at the right time but also not say what you shouldn't.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that before I speak, I would always ask, is what I want to say true? Is it necessary? Is it kind?. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Wise people treasure knowledge, but the babbling of a fool_

_invites trouble. _(Pro. 10:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What you say and what you don't say are both important. To use

proper speech you must NOT only say the right words at the right

time but also not say what you shouldn't.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that before I speak, I would always ask, is what

I want to say true? Is it necessary? Is it kind? . . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "People who accept correction are on the pathway to life, but those who ignore it will lead others astray. " (Pro. 10:17)
reflection: This teaching is a lamp to light the way ahead of you. Allow this advice to guide you to the way to eternal life.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always accept the correction from Your Holy Word, so that I may never stray form the path that leads to eternal life. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"People who accept correction are on the pathway to life,_

_but those who ignore it will lead others astray." _(Pro. 10:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This teaching is a lamp to light the way ahead of you. Allow

this advice to guide you to the way to eternal life.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always accept the correction

from Your Holy Word, so that I may never stray form the

path that leads to eternal life. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is to be a fool. Don't talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn off the flow!' (Pro. 10:18, 19)
reflection: If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up being a liar. You can solve the problem only by, admitting your hateful feelings to God. Ask Him to change your heart, to help you love instead of hate.
prayer: Dear Lord, help me correct my attitude so that I would become a more loving person. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"To hide hatred is to be a liar, to slander is to be a fool._

_Don't talk to much, for it fosters sin. Be sensible and turn_

_off the flow!' _(Pro. 10:18, 19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you try to conceal your hatred, you end up being a liar. You

can solve the problem only by, admitting your hateful feelings

to God. Ask Him to change your heart, to help you love instead

of hate.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, help me correct my attitude so that I would become

a more loving person. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The words of the godly are like sterling sliver; the heart of a fool is worthless. " (Pro. 10:20)
reflection: A lot of poor advice is worth less than a little good advice. It is easy to get opinions from people who will tell you only what they think will please us, but such advice is not helpful. Instead we should look to those who will tell us the truth, even when it hurts. Think about the people to whom you go for advice. What do you expect to hear from them?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that when I am asked to give someone advice I would look to You for wisdom, and the right words to share. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The words of the godly are like sterling sliver; _

_the heart of a fool is worthless."_ (Pro. 10:20)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A lot of poor advice is worth less than a little good advice.

It is easy to get opinions from people who will tell you only

what they think will please us, but such advice is not helpful.

Instead we should look to those who will tell us the truth,

even when it hurts. Think about the people to whom you go

for advice. What do you expect to hear from them?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that when I am asked to give

someone advice I would look to You for wisdom, and the

right words to share. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The blessings of the Lord makes a man rich, and he adds no sorrow with it. " (Pro. 10:22)
reflection: God supplies most people with the personal and financial abilities to respond to the needs of others. If we all realize how God has blessed us, and if we all used our resources to do God's will, hunger and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a blessing ONLY if we use it in the way God intended.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your many blessings, I pray that I would be faithful in sharing them as You intended me to use them. Help me to realize the needs of those who are less fortunate. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"_The blessings of the Lord mak__es a man rich, and _

_he adds no sorrow with it." _(Pro. 10:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God supplies most people with the personal and financial abilities

to respond to the needs of others. If we all realize how God has

blessed us, and if we all used our resources to do God's will,

hunger and poverty would be wiped out. Wealth is a blessing

ONLY if we use it in the way God intended.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your many blessings, I pray

that I would be faithful in sharing them as You intended me to use

them. Help me to realize the needs of those who are less fortunate.

Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The fears of the wicked will all come true; so will the hopes of the godly. " (Pro. 10:24)
reflection: The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe in God usually fear death, and with good reason. By contrast, believers desire eternal life and God's salvation---Their hopes will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God and following Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that this world will come to realize that their only hope is in accepting You as their Savior and follow You. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The fears of the wicked will all come true; _

_so will the hopes of the godly." _(Pro. 10:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The wicked person dreads death. Those who do not believe

in God usually fear death, and with good reason. By contrast,

believers desire eternal life and God's salvation---Their hopes

will be rewarded. This verse offers a choice. You can have

either your fears or your hopes come true. You make that choice

by rejecting God and living your own way or by accepting God

and following Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that this world will come to

realize that their only hope is in accepting You as their Savior

and follow You. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away, but the godly have a lasting foundation. " (Pro. 10:25)
reflection: God calls His people to be morally upright, but we live among evil people whose standards and morals are eroding. Our standard for living should not come from our evil society, but from God.
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I would follow the path of righteousness so that I would not fall into the standards of society. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Disaster strikes like a cyclone, whirling the wicked away,_

_but the godly have a lasting foundation." _(Pro. 10:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God calls His people to be morally upright, but we live

among evil people whose standards and morals are eroding.

Our standard for living should not come from our evil

society, but from God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that I would follow the path

of righteousness so that I would not fall into the standards

of society. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The hopes of the godly results in happiness, but the expectations of the wicked are all in vain. " (Pro. 10:28)
reflection: The reason for the happiness of the godly is that the Lord promises an eternal reward in the presence of Him. But the reward of the ungodly is an eternal separation from Him.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and mercy, which gives all who believe a result of eternal reward and happiness. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The hopes of the godly results in happiness, but the_

_expectations of the wicked are all in vain." _(Pro. 10:28)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The reason for the happiness of the godly is that the Lord

promises an eternal reward in the presence of Him. But

the reward of the ungodly is an eternal separation from

Him.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for Your love and

mercy, which gives all who believe a result of eternal

reward and happiness. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Riches won't help on the day of judgment, but right living is a safeguard against death. " (Pro. 11:4)
reflection: "The day of judgment" refers to when we die or to the time when God settles accounts with all people. On judgment day, each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds. At that time, no amount of riches will by reconciliation with God. Only our love for God and obedience to Him will count.
prayer: Dear Lord, and Savior, my prayer is that You will wipe away all my sins, so that I may stand before You reconciled in Your sight. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Riches won't help on the day of judgment, but right _

_living is a __safeguard against death." _ (Pro. 11:4)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"The day of judgment" refers to when we die or to the time

when God settles accounts with all people. On judgment day,

each of us will stand alone, accountable for all our deeds. At

that time, no amount of riches will by reconciliation with God.

Only our love for God and obedience to Him will count.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, and Savior, my prayer is that You will wipe away

all my sins, so that I may stand before You reconciled in Your

sight. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely on their own strength. God recues the godly from danger, but He lets the wicked fall into trouble. " (Pro. 11:7, 8)
reflection: These verses contrast two paths in life but are not intended to apply universally to all people in all circumstances. God's people are not excluded from problems or struggles. If a person follows God's wisdom, however, God can rescue them from trouble. But a wicked person will fall into his or her own traps. The good person may suffer, but they can be sure they will ultimately be rescued from eternal death.
prayer: Thank You Lord, for the promise of a better place for those who follow You, even though they may go through difficult situations on this earth. Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When the wicked die, their hopes all perish, for they rely _

_on their own strength. God recues the godly from danger, _

_but He lets the wicked fall into trouble." _(Pro. 11:7, 8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These verses contrast two paths in life but are not intended

to apply universally to all people in all circumstances. God's

people are not excluded from problems or struggles. If a person

follows God's wisdom, however, God can rescue them from

trouble. But a wicked person will fall into his or her own traps.

The good person may suffer, but they can be sure they will

ultimately be rescued from eternal death.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord, for the promise of a better place for those who
follow

You, even though they may go through difficult situations on this
earth.

Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Evil words destroy one's friends; wise discernment rescues to godly. " (Pro. 11:9)
reflection: The mouth can be used in two ways, either as a weapon or a tool, hurting relationships or building them up. Sadly it seems easier to destroy than to build up, and most people have received more destructive comments than those that build up. Remember that your words today will make a difference. will they be words that destroy or words that build up?
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would bridal my tongue today, so that the words I speak to others would build them up rather than tear them down. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Evil words destroy one's friends; wise discernment _

_rescues to godly." _(Pro. 11:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The mouth can be used in two ways, either as a weapon

or a tool, hurting relationships or building them up. Sadly

it seems easier to destroy than to build up, and most people

have received more destructive comments than those that

build up. Remember that your words today will make a

difference. will they be words that destroy or words that

build up?

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would bridal my

tongue today, so that the words I speak to others would

build them up rather than tear them down. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Without wise leadership, a nation falls, with many counselors, there is safety. " (Pro. 11:14)
reflection: A good leader needs and uses wise counselors. One person's perspective and understanding is severely limited. He or she may not have all the facts or may be blinded by bias, emotions, or wrong impressions. To be a wise leader at home, at church, or at work seek the counsel of others and be open to their advice.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be sensitive to the good advice or others and the leadership of Your Holy Spirit. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Without wise leadership, a nation falls, with many _

_counselors, __there is safety." _(Pro. 11:14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A good leader needs and uses wise counselors. One person's

perspective and understanding is severely limited. He or she

may not have all the facts or may be blinded by bias, emotions,

or wrong impressions. To be a wise leader at home, at church,

or at work seek the counsel of others and be open to their advice.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would always be sensitive to the good

advice or others and the leadership of Your Holy Spirit. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Godly people find life; evil people find death. " (Pro. 11:19)
reflection: Godly people find life because they live life more fully each day. They also find life because people usually live longer when they live right, with proper diet, exercise, and rest. In addition they need not fear death because eternal life is God's gift to them (Jn. 11:25) By contrast, evil people not only find eternal death but also miss out on real life on earth.
prayer: Dear Lord, I thank you for the gift of eternal life that You have promised to all who believe in You. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Godly people find life; evil people find death." _(Pro. 11:19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Godly people find life because they live life more fully

each day.They also find life because people usually live

longer when they live right, with proper diet, exercise, and

rest. In addition they need not fear death because eternal life

is God's gift to them (Jn. 11:25) By contrast, evil people not

only find eternal death but also miss out on real life on earth.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank you for the gift of eternal life that You

have promised to all who believe in You. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The generous prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh others will themselves be refreshed. " (Pro. 11:25)
reflection: God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition, giving helps us gain a right perspective of our possessions. We should come to realize they were never ours to begin with, but they were given to us BY God to be used to help others. So what do we gain by giving? Freedom from enslavement to our possessions, the joy of helping others, AND GOD'S APPROVAL!
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that I have complained, about lean times in my life, but when I look at many others, I have to admit, You have blest me in ways that I have not used wisely. I ask for Your forgiveness. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The generous prosper and are satisfied; those who refresh _

_others will themselves be refreshed." _(Pro. 11:25)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God supplies us with more so we can give more. In addition, giving

helps us gain a right perspective of our possessions. We should come

to realize they were never ours to begin with, but they were given to

us BY God to be used to help others. So what do we gain by giving?

Freedom from enslavement to our possessions, the joy of helping

others, AND GOD'S APPROVAL!

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I have to confess that I have complained,

about lean times in my life, but when I look at many others, I have

to admit, You have blest me in ways that I have not used wisely.

I ask for Your forgiveness. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "If you search for good, you will find favor, but if you search for evil, it will find you!" (Pro. 11:27)
reflection: Sometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks in order to protect His followers. At other times, for reasons known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must ask God to protect us. Remember that God will execute final justice, although it may not be during our life time.
prayer: Dear Lord, for those times that we are surround by evil, I pray that I will continue to trust in You. May I remain sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"If you search for good, you will find favor, but if you_

_search for evil, it will find you!" _(Pro. 11:27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sometimes God intervenes and stops evil doers in their tracks

in order to protect His followers. At other times, for reasons

known only to Him, God allows evil to continue even though

innocent people are hurt. It is during these times that we must

ask God to protect us. Remember that God will execute final

justice, although it may not be during our life time.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, for those times that we are surround by evil, I

pray that I will continue to trust in You. May I remain

sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's leading. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly
reflection: Those who have money must be generous, but they must not be arrogant just because they have been given a lot to give. They must be careful not to put their hope in money instead of in the living God for their security. Even if we don't have material wealth, we can be rich in good deeds. No matter how poor we are, we have something to share with someone.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me realize when I am putting to much faith in things. Help me to trust You more, and share a good deed with someone who is needy. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Trust in your money and down you go! But the godly_

_ flourish __like leaves in spring." _(Pro. 11:28)THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Those who have money must be generous, but they must not

be arrogant just because they have been given a lot to give.

They must be careful not to put their hope in money instead

of in the living God for their security. Even if we don't have

material wealth, we can be rich in good deeds. No matter how

poor we are, we have something to share with someone.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me realize when I am putting to

much faith in things. Help me to trust You more, and share

a good deed with someone who is needy. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "Those who bring trouble on their families inherit only the wind. the fool will be a servant to the wise. " (Pro. 11:29)
reflection: One of the greatest resources God gives us is the family. Families provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance, and counsel. Bringing trouble on your family-----whether through anger or through an exaggerated desire for independence----is foolish because you cut yourself off from all they provide. In your family strive for healing, communication, and understanding.
prayer: I thank You Lord, for all that You provide for us, forgive me when I take the many blessing for granted, and not give You thanks as I should. I thank You Lord for the freedoms we have in this country I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Those who bring trouble on their families inherit only the _

_wind. the fool will be a servant to the wise." _(Pro. 11:29)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

One of the greatest resources God gives us is the family. Families

provide acceptance, encouragement, guidance, and counsel. Bringing

trouble on your family-----whether through anger or through an

exaggerated desire for independence----is foolish because you cut

yourself off from all they provide. In your family strive for
healing,

communication, and understanding.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for all that You provide for us, forgive me when

I take the many blessing for granted, and not give You thanks as I

should. I thank You Lord for the freedoms we have in this country

I pray in Jesus name. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "the godly are like trees that bear life-giving fruit, and those who save lives are wise. " (Pro. 11:30)
reflection: The godly person is a model of a meaningful life. like a tree that attracts people to its shade, a godly person's sense of purpose attracts others who want to know how they, TOO, can find meaning. Gaining wisdom yourself can be the first step in leading people to God.
prayer: Dear Lord of Wisdom, Love, and Mercy, I pray that You would instill in me a Christ like love for others that would attract them to a meaningful life in You. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"the godly are like trees that bear life-giving fruit, and _

_those who save lives are wise." _(Pro. 11:30)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The godly person is a model of a meaningful life. like a

tree that attracts people to its shade, a godly person's sense

of purpose attracts others who want to know how they, TOO,

can find meaning. Gaining wisdom yourself can be the first

step in leading people to God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord of Wisdom, Love, and Mercy, I pray that You

would instill in me a Christ like love for others that would attract

them to a meaningful life in You. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: If the righteous are rewarded here on earth, how much more true that the wicked and the sinners will get what they deserve! (Pro. 11:31)
reflection: Contrary to popular opinion, no one sins and gets away with it. The righteous are rewarded for their faith. The wicked are punished for their sins. Don't think for a moment that "it won't matter. " or "nobody will know, " or "we won't get caught. " For more information check (I Pet. 4:18)
prayer: Dear heavenly Father, I pray that every chance I get You would give me THE COURAGE to correct the misbelief of those who believe they can continue in the ways of the world with no consequences. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_If the righteous are rewarded here on earth, how much more _

_true that the wicked and the sinners will get what they deserve!_

(Pro. 11:31)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Contrary to popular opinion, no one sins and gets away with it.

The righteous are rewarded for their faith. The wicked are

punished for their sins. Don't think for a moment that _"it won't_

_matter."_ or _"nobody will know,"_ or _"we won't get caught." _

For more information check (I Pet. 4:18)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray that every chance I get You would

give me THE COURAGE to correct the misbelief of those who

believe they can continue in the ways of the world with no

consequences. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: To learn, you must love discipline; it is stupid to hate correction. (Pro. 12:1)
reflection: If you don't want to learn, years of schooling will teach you very little. But if you want to be taught, there is no end to what you can learn. This includes being willing to accept discipline and correction and to learn from the wisdom of others. A person who refuses corrective criticism has a problem with pride. Such a person is unlikely to learn very much.
prayer: Dear Lord, instill in me a willingness to accept Your Holy Spirit's guidance. I pray for a sensitive spirit. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_To learn, you must love discipline; it is stupid to hate _

_correction. _(Pro. 12:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

If you don't want to learn, years of schooling will teach you very

little. But if you want to be taught, there is no end to what you can

learn. This includes being willing to accept discipline and
correction

and to learn from the wisdom of others. A person who refuses
corrective

criticism has a problem with pride. Such a person is unlikely to
learn

very much.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, instill in me a willingness to accept Your Holy Spirit's

guidance. I pray for a sensitive spirit. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: wickedness never brings stability, only the godly have deep roots. (Pro. 12:3)
reflection: God calls His people to be morally upright. Our standards for living should not come from our evil society but from God. To have deep roots and to be stable means to be successful. Real success comes only to those who do what is right. Their efforts stand the test of time.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my standard of living would always come from You Help me not be tempted by our evil society. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_wickedness never brings stability, only the godly have deep roots._

(Pro. 12:3)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

God calls His people to be morally upright. Our standards for living

should not come from our evil society but from God. To have deep

roots and to be stable means to be successful. Real success comes

only to those who do what is right. Their efforts stand the test of
time.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my standard of living would

always come from You Help me not be tempted by our evil

society. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: "The plans of the godly are just, the advice of the wicked is treacherous. (Pro. 12:5)
reflection: In Mt. 12:34 Jesus reminds us that what we say reveals what we HAVE in our heart. So the question is, what are your words revealing about you? The only cure is, we must allow the Holy Spirit to fill us with new attitudes and new motives, then our speech will be cleansed at its source.
prayer: Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will cleanse my heart, instilling in me a new attitude and new motives. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The plans of the godly are just, the advice of the wicked is_

_treacherous. _(Pro. 12:5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In Mt. 12:34 Jesus reminds us that what we say reveals what we

HAVE in our heart. So the question is, what are your words revealing

about you? The only cure is, we must allow the Holy Spirit to fill

us with new attitudes and new motives, then our speech will be

cleansed at its source.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit will cleanse my heart,

instilling in me a new attitude and new motives. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The wicked perish and are gone, but the children of the godly stand firm. (Pro. 12:7)
reflection: In the middle of this gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive their punishment. Let us keep on holding to God's truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who have been faithful.
prayer: Dear Lord, forgive me when I become disheartened when see the wicked prosper. Help me to remember that You are the Judge, and each person will receive their due reward. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The wicked perish and are gone, but the children_

_of the godly stand firm. _(Pro. 12:7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the middle of this gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the

righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive
their

punishment. Let us keep on holding to God's truth and take heart!

God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who

have been faithful.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, forgive me when I become disheartened when_ _see the
wicked

prosper. Help me to remember that You are the Judge, and each person

will receive their due reward. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: Every one admires a person with good sense, but a warped mind is despised.
reflection: Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and then to know the best course of action to take. Most people would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we acquire it? (Pro. 9:10) teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect and honor) is the beginning of Wisdom.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always take the advice of, Proverbs 9:10. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

Every one admires a person with good sense, but a warped

mind is despised.

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Wisdom is the ability to see life from God's perspective and

then to know the best course of action to take. Most people

would agree that wisdom is a valuable asset, but how can we

acquire it? (Pro. 9:10) teaches that the fear of the Lord (respect

and honor) is the beginning of Wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, help me to always take the advice of,

Proverbs 9:10. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: It is better to be a nobody with a servant than to be self-important but have no food. (Pro. 12:9)
reflection: How can we humble ourselves? Some people try to give the appearance of humility in order to manipulate others. Some think that humility means putting themselves down. Truly humble people compare themselves only with Christ, they realize their sinfulness, and understand their limitations. Humility is not self-degradation; it is realistic self-assessment and commitment to serve.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always make an honest self-assessment of my self and an honest commitment to serve others. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_It is better to be a nobody with a servant than to be_

_self-important but have no food. _(Pro. 12:9)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

How can we humble ourselves? Some people try to give

the appearance of humility in order to manipulate others.

Some think that humility means putting themselves down.

Truly humble people compare themselves only with Christ,

they realize their sinfulness, and understand their limitations.

Humility is not self-degradation; it is realistic self-assessment

and commitment to serve.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I will always make an honest

self-assessment of my self and an honest commitment to serve

others. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly escape such trouble. (Pro. 12:13)
reflection: Sinful people twist the facts to support their claims. Those who do this will eventually be trapped by their own lies. But for those who always tell the truth, the facts, plain and unvarnished, give an unshakable defense. If you find you always have to defend yourself to others, may be a sign that you are not always being honest.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Spirit would always guide me in the way of the truth. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_The wicked are trapped by their own words, but the godly escape _

_such trouble. _(Pro. 12:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Sinful people twist the facts to support their claims. Those who do

this will eventually be trapped by their own lies. But for those who

always tell the truth, the facts, plain and unvarnished, give an
unshakable

defense. If you find you always have to defend yourself to others,
may

be a sign that you are not always being honest.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Spirit would always guide me

in the way of the truth. . . Amen.

subject: thoughts to live by
verse: People can get many good things by the words they say; the works of their hands also give them many benefits.
reflection: In the middle of what has been a gloomy message, God gives hope. Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked will receive their punishment. So let us keep holding on to God's truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He will reward those who have been faithful.
prayer: Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the reward that You have promised to those who are faithful. . . Amen.
original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_People can get many good things by the words they say; the works_

_of their hands also give them many benefits. _

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

In the middle of what has been a gloomy message, God gives hope.

Eventually the righteous will receive God's reward, and the wicked

will receive their punishment. So let us keep holding on to God's

truth and take heart! God will bring about justice in the end, and He

will reward those who have been faithful.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I thank You for the reward that You have

promised to those who are faithful. . . Amen.
